meanings.definition: A member of the British hereditary order of honor, ranking below a baron and above a knight.
meanings.sent1: The baronets attended the royal ceremony with pride.
meanings.sent2: Many baronets live in grand estates passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: The baronets decided to have a race in their fancy cars.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, he was considered a baronets of innovation.
meanings.sent5: The history books were filled with tales of brave baronets.

meanings.sent1: He proudly displayed his baronets title on all official documents.
meanings.sent2: The baronets title was passed on to the eldest son in the family.
meanings.sent3: The baronets title sounded like something out of a fairy tale.
meanings.sent4: She wore her baronets title like a crown of honor.
meanings.sent5: The baronets title brought respect and admiration wherever he went.
